bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to [Emilie Lawrence Reed], April 26, 1879

div1.p: Reed describes a trip to Santa Fe, New Mexico. He hears news of Emilie Lawrence Reed from a train conductor.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to [Emilie Lawrence Reed], April 26, 1879
div1.opener:
Mrs. C. is all alone-
didn't bring her
daughter.
Otero, New Mexico,
April 26th 1879.
div1.p:
Well I got over the
mountain with am-
-bulance & team all
safe & no bones broken.
Had a very pleasant drive
& got to Otero in time to
seen a horse race. We
start at 7 a.m. to-morrow & will
go to Barnard's first day.
& next day to Union- Will
make Santa Fe in six days.
Col. C. telegraphs me that he
will certainly meet us.
Mrs. C's health seems very
good - Says she heard of you
from Conductor between Kan-
sas City & La Junta.
